Sequence Information.Peptide Name: LM2 (Lactomodulin fragment, Gly-rich, Synthetic AMPs, XXA, UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (45.45%) toPeptide fraction IIG: 30%, I=P: 20%.Activity: active against S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 2.1 uM), MRSA BAA 2313 (NA), C. difficile ATCC 43602 (MIC 1.6 uM), L. monocytogenes ATCC 15313 (MIC 1.2 uM), E.faecium VRE BAA 2317 (NA), E. coli ATCC 33694 (MIC 8.9 uM), P. aeruginosa BAA 1744 (MIC 9.5 uM), and S.enterica ATCC 13314 (NA). NA: not observed.
Literature Information.Author: Mousa WK, Shaikh AY, Ghemrawi R, Aldulaimi M, Al Ali A, Sammani N, Khair M, Helal MI, Al-Marzooq F, Oueis E. 2024
Literature Information.Title: Human microbiome derived synthetic antimicrobial peptides with activity against Gram-negative, Gram-positive, and antibiotic resistant bacteria.
